text: `read` is a command found on Unix and Unix-like operating systems such as Linux. It reads a line of input from standard input or a file passed as an argument to its `-u` flag, and assigns it to a variable. In Unix shells, like Bash, it is present as a shell built in function, and not as a separate executable file. ==References== Category:Standard Unix programs Category:Unix process- and task-management-related software
title: Read (Unix)
